captions.text:
INTRO------
HI GUYS I’M CATIE WAYNE AND THIS IS ANIMALIST

NEWS.
HOW MUCH WOULD IT SUCK TO BE TOLD THAT YOU’RE

A CERTAIN SPECIES YOUR ENTIRE LIFE AND THEN
ONE DAY WAKE UP AND FIND OUT YOU’RE SOMETHING

COMPLETELY DIFFERENT!?
THAT’S WHAT HAPPENS TO MANY ANIMALS WHEN

THEY’RE FIRST DISCOVERED.
AS HUMANS, WE HAVE THIS URGE TO CATEGORIZE

ANIMALS BASED ON PHYSICAL TRAITS ALONE, HOWEVER,
ANIMAL CLASSIFICATION CAN BE MESSY…

TAKE THE OLINGUITO FOR EXAMPLE.
FOR OVER A CENTURY THIS CUTE LITTLE TEDDY

BEAR LOOKING ANIMAL WAS MISIDENTIFIED AS AN
OLINGO.

I KNOW WHAT YOU’RE THINKING, OLINGO...OLINGUITO…
THAT SOUNDS LIKE THE SAME THING.

WELL NEWSFLASH BUDDY, THEY ARE TWO VERY DIFFERENT
SPECIES!

IT WASN’T UNTIL 2013 THAT SCIENTISTS AT
THE SMITHSONIAN DISCOVERED THAT THE OLINGUITO

HAD COMPLETELY DIFFERENT TEETH AND SKULLS
THAN THE OLINGO.

ON TOP OF ALL THAT A DNA TEST SHOWED THAT
OLINGUITOS HAVE BEEN INDEPENDENTLY EVOLVING

FOR NEARLY FOUR MILLION YEARS!
NOW WHAT ABOUT AN ANIMAL WE ALL KNOW AND LOVE?

THE GIANT PANDA WAS FIRST SEEN BY WESTERNERS
IN 1869 WHEN A PRIEST LIKENED IT TO A BEAR.

BUT THEN THIS SCIENTIST CAME ALONG AND DECIDED
THAT THE GIANT PANDA LOOKED MORE LIKE RED

PANDAS WHICH BELONG TO THE RACOON FAMILY.
BOTH OF THESE ARGUMENTS HAVE THEIR MERITS.

GIANT AND RED PANDAS EAT BAMBOO, HOLD OBJECTS
THE SAME WAY, AND HAVE SIMILAR PAW AND SNOUT

FEATURES.
ON THE OTHER HAND, GIANT PANDAS HAVE THE SAME

SHAPE, SIZE, AND STRIDE AS A BEAR.
SO WHICH ONE IS IT REALLY?

ACCORDING TO DNA STUDIES, THE GIANT PANDA
IS MORE CLOSELY RELATED TO THE BEAR FAMILY,

HOWEVER, GIANT AND RED PANDAS MAY HAVE DEVELOPED
SIMILAR BAMBOO RELATED FEATURES DUE TO CONVERGENT

EVOLUTION.
IF YOU THOUGHT THE OLINGUITO AND THE GIANT

PANDA HAD IT BAD, MEET THE OKAPI.
THIS POOR THING HAS BEEN MISIDENTIFIED NOT

ONCE, NOT TWICE, BUT THREE TIMES!
OKAPIS WERE NOT DISCOVERED UNTIL THE END OF

THE NINETEENTH CENTURY WHEN EUROPEAN EXPLORERS
CONFUSED THEM FOR A SPECIES OF ZEBRA.

WHEN THEY RETURNED HOME AND REPORTED SEEING
THE STRANGE ANIMAL, MANY EUROPEANS BELIEVED

THE OKAPI WAS A MYTH AND BEGAN CALLING IT
THE “AFRICAN UNICORN”.

AT THE SAME TIME, AMERICAN EXPLORERS BEGAN
SPEAKING ABOUT A LEAF EATING AFRICAN DONKEY.

THEN IN 1901, THE BRITISH HIGH COMMISSIONER
OF UGANDA WAS ABLE TO CONFIRM THE OKAPI’S

EXISTENCE BY FINDING A SKULL AND HIDE...BUT
HE STILL HAD NO IDEA WHAT SPECIES IT WAS.

NOW DNA EVIDENCE SHOWS THAT THE OKAPI IS THE
ONLY LIVING RELATIVE OF THE GIRAFFE AND SHARES

MANY OF THE SAME FEATURES SUCH AS A LONG TONGUE,
OVER SIZED EARS, AND SKIN COVERED HORNS.

DO YOU THINK THERE’S ANY ANIMALS WERE MISIDENTIFYING
NOW?

LET ME KNOW IN THE COMMENTS BELOW!
THANKS FOR WATCHING!

BE SURE TO CHECK OUT THESE AWESOME VIDEOS,
FOLLOW OUR INSTAGRAM @ANIMALISTS, AND SUBSCRIBE

DOWN BELOW.
I LOVE YOU ALL! BYE!

title: Are Giant Pandas Bears or Raccoons?
